definition: to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: In the 51st minute, Maradona turned villain in the eyes of purists and moralists everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 第51分钟，马拉多纳成为了一些卫道士眼中的魔鬼。

sentences.english: The old guard can meet this challenge through the press and the courts.
sentences.chinese: 老一代卫道士能够通过新闻界和法院应付这些挑战。

sentences.english: He is considered a guardian of faith.
sentences.chinese: 他被认为是一名卫道士。

sentences.english: In India, you will find different types of apologists.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，你可以找到不同类型的卫道士。

definition: angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
